intro: Barbacenia sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower barbacenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Barbacenia sessiliflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
